title: "Those Who Fired Shots At Ram Bhakts...": Yogi Adityanath
desc: Urging people to vote for the BJP in urban local body polls, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, said that BJP will take Ayodhya to the pinnacle of development.

title: 'The Kerala Story' Crew Member Provided Security After Threat: Mumbai Cops
desc: A crew member of the movie 'The Kerala Story' received a threatening message from an unknown number, according to Mumbai Police.

title: 2020 Delhi Riots: Court Directs To Record Statement Of Man Beaten By Cops
desc: The Delhi High Court directed the police to record the statement of one of the five men, allegedly beaten by cops and forced to sing the national anthem, before the magistrate within a week.

title: The Kerala Story Is "Likely To Cause Breach Of Peace": Bengal On Film Ban
desc: The West Bengal in a notification said that the movie 'The Kerala Story' is "likely to cause a breach of peace" and that it has prohibited the screening of the film to avoid "any incident of hatred or violence to maintain law and order in the state".

title: Gold Biscuits Worth Rs 4.24 Crore Seized In Bengal, 2 Bangladeshi Arrested
desc: Border Security Force on Monday apprehended two smugglers and seized 52 gold biscuits worth Rs four crore 24 lacks at Integrated Check Post (ICP) Petrapole in North 24 Parganas district of West Bengal.

title: "Your Resolution Is My Resolution": PM To Karnataka People Ahead Of Polls
desc: After the high-voltage campaign for the May 10 assembly elections in Karnataka ended, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday assured the people of the state saying that he envisioned their dreams as his own.

title: Delhi Police Bust Interstate Railway Job Racket, 4 Arrested
desc: Four people have been arrested for their alleged involvement in an interstate railway job racket, Delhi Police said on Monday.

title: Amit Shah Arrives In Kolkata For Day-Long Visit
desc: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday arrived in Kolkata for his day-long visit to the state.

title: "Man-Made Problem": Mamata Banerjee Slams Centre Over Manipur Violence
desc: Expressing concern over the current situation in violence-hit Manipur, West Bengal CN Mamata Banerjee alleged that BJP government is not providing a clear picture of the death toll in the northeastern state where shoot-at-sight orders are in force.

title: Goa Announces Paid Holiday On Karnataka Election Day
desc: The BJP government in Goa has declared May 10 as paid holiday, which will also cover private establishments and industrial workers, in view of voting for Assembly polls scheduled in neighbouring Karnataka on that day.

title: Centre Bans Apple Imports Under Rs 50 Per Kg
desc: The government on Monday banned the import of apples if its imported price is less than Rs 50 per kg.

title: Haryana Wrestling Body Suspends 3 For Alleged Involvement In Delhi Protests
desc: Haryana Amateur Wrestling Association (HAWA) has suspended the secretaries of three affiliated district units for their alleged involvement in the agitation against Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh in Delhi.

title: Man Kills Wife For Cooking Curry Without Rice, Arrested: Cops
desc: A man was detained by the police in Odisha's Sambalpur district on Monday for allegedly bludgeoning his wife to death for not cooking rice, police said.

title: 238 Stolen, Smuggled Antiquities Brought Back To India Since 2014: Centre
desc: Nearly 240 antiquities have been brought back to India from various countries in the last nine years and 72 more of such artefacts are in the process of being repatriated, the government said on Monday.

title: Rs 2,000 Crore Liquor Scam In Chhattisgarh: Enforcement Directorate
desc: An alleged liquor scam worth more than Rs 2,000 crore has been unearthed in Chhattisgarh, the Enforcement Directorate has claimed, at a time when a similar case in Delhi continues to make headlines.

title: Karnataka BJP Gets Poll Body Notice Over Advertisement Against Congress
desc: The Election Commission on Monday asked the Karnataka BJP to provide "verifiable and traceable" facts by Tuesday evening regarding its newspaper advertisement describing the Congress as "the most corrupt party in the world".

title: 14 Roads Closed For Traffic After Heavy Snowfall In Himachal
desc: Total 14 roads, including two national highways, were closed for vehicular traffic in Himachal Pradesh following heavy snowfall in its different parts, an official said on Monday.

title: Australia Will Track Those Responsible For Hindu Temples' Vandalism: Envoy
desc: Australian High Commissioner to India Barry O'Farrell said that his Prime Minister Anthony Albanese ensured that the security forces take action when the vandalism of Hindu temples occurred and also track those responsible and prosecute them.

title: Son Sets Father On Fire In Rajasthan After Fight, Arrested: Cops
desc: A 46-year-old man was allegedly burned alive by his son in Churu district's Sardarshahar area, police said on Monday.

title: "Will Take Legal Action": 'The Kerala Story' Producer On West Bengal Ban
desc: "The Kerala Story" producer Vipul Shah on Monday said they will take legal action against the ban imposed by the West Bengal government on the screening of the film in the state.
